properties.headline: Flood Warning issued January 10 at 10:27AM CST by NWS Paducah KY
properties.description:
...The National Weather Service in Paducah, Kentucky has issued a
flood warning for the following rivers in Indiana...

Patoka River near Princeton

.River levels along the Patoka River are rising due to heavy
rainfall of 1 to 2 inches that has fallen over the past 24 hours
combined with additional heavy rain forecast over the next 36 hours.
Moderate flooding is forecast to develop at Princeton. River levels
are forecast to rise above flood stage Saturday morning and crest
near 21.7 feet late next week.

The National Weather Service in Paducah, Kentucky has issued a

* Flood Warning for
the Patoka River near Princeton.
* from Saturday morning until further notice.
* At  9:45 AM Friday the stage was 16.7 feet.
* Flood Stage is 18.0 feet.
* Moderate flooding is forecast.
* Forecast...Rise above flood stage by tomorrow late morning and
continue to rise to near 21.7 feet by Friday evening January 17th.
* Impact...At 22.0 Feet...Flooding affects mainly farmland. Seasonal
camping trailers closest to the river become inundated.
properties.instruction:
SAFETY MESSAGE...

Never drive cars...trucks or sport utility vehicles through flooded
areas. The water may be too deep to allow safe passage. Never allow
children to play in or near flood waters. Stay tuned to NOAA Weather
Radio or your local media for further statements and possible updated
forecasts.

Additional information is available at
http://www.crh.noaa.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=pah /lower case/
